hero.titulo: Share and discover long-distance backpacking trips
hero.testimonial_role: Backpacker and content creator at Pack&Go
hero.testimonial_text: Backpacking taught me that freedom isn't about reaching every destination, but enjoying every step of the way.

stats.title: “Adventures ready to live”
stats.subtitle: Join thousands of backpackers sharing their experiences on accommodation, visas, transport, and adventures.

destinations.title: “New experiences”
destinations.subtitle: The latest in backpacking travel
destinations.sydney_desc: Discover the magic of Sydney, a vibrant city where nature and urban life blend in perfect harmony. From the iconic Opera House to the waves of Bondi Beach.
destinations.outback_desc: Venture into Australia's red heart and discover the vastness of the Outback desert. Between golden dunes and starry skies, you will live an authentic experience.

sections.blogs_subtitle: In case you feel like reading a bit

testimonials.review1: "I followed your recommended route through the Balkans and it was incredible. I never would have found those hostels on my own. Thanks for the tips!"
testimonials.review2: "The article on traveling with 7kg saved my back. I never believed one could travel so light and happy without missing anything."
testimonials.review3: "I was looking for inspiration for my gap year and this blog gave me the push I needed. The photos of India are pure magic."

blog.hero_subtitle: Meet stories from other travelers on this blog

id_1.title: World corners every backpacker should visit in 2025
id_1.summary: Backpacking never goes out of style. Every year new corners appear that become trends...

id_2.title: The 10 most surprising destinations in India
id_2.summary: India is a continent in itself. Discover forgotten temples, spice routes and landscapes that defy imagination.

id_3.title: The best kept secrets of the backpacking world
id_3.summary: Save money, pack light and meet local people. We tell you the experts' secrets to travel further with less.

id_4.title: New backpacker paradises you should know
id_4.summary: If you are looking for total disconnection, these natural parks and pristine beaches are for you. Places where Wi-Fi doesn't reach, but the connection is total.

id_5.title: Around the world in 80 dishes: Unmissable street food
id_5.summary: Forget white tablecloth restaurants. The true culture of a country is boiled, fried and served on the sidewalks.

id_4.title: Imperial Getaway to Vienna
id_4.desc_short: Classical music, palaces, and coffee culture
id_4.desc_long: An imperial city with museums and classical music at every step. Schönbrunn Palace and the Ringstrasse condense baroque and historicism, while cafés like Demel maintain the pastry tradition. Ideal for walking between parks and opera houses.

step_1.title: Historic Arrival
step_1.desc: Walk along the Ringstrasse and first slice of Sacher torte.

step_2.title: Imperial Palaces
step_2.desc: Guided tour of Schönbrunn Palace and its gardens.

step_3.title: Music and Art
step_3.desc: Night at the Vienna State Opera.

id_5.title: Fairytale Bruges
id_5.desc_long: A perfectly preserved medieval center, tree-lined canals, and cobbled squares like the Markt. Belfries, guild houses, and chocolate shops create a fairytale atmosphere that invites you to get lost without hurry.

step_2.title: Belfort Tower
step_2.desc: Climb the bell tower and chocolate tasting.

id_6.title: Design in Copenhagen
id_6.desc_long: Balance between contemporary design and Nordic tradition. Nyhavn, Tivoli, and cycling neighborhoods show a human and welcoming city; avant-garde gastronomy and respect for public space.

step_2.title: Tivoli Gardens
step_2.desc: Fun day at the oldest amusement park.

id_7.title: Charm of Ljubljana
id_7.desc_long: Small and scenic capital, with a pedestrian center, riverside cafés, and the castle on top. Ideal base for excursions to Lake Bled and the Julian Alps.

step_1.title: Castle
step_1.desc: Funicular ride up to the castle.

step_2.title: Lake Bled
step_2.desc: Full-day excursion to the neighboring lake.

id_8.title: Modernist Barcelona
id_8.desc_long: Gaudí's modernism, sea, and mountains on the same plane. The Sagrada Familia, Park Güell, and neighborhood life coexist with markets and museums; walks from Montjuïc to the beaches.

step_2.title: Gothic Quarter
step_2.desc: Walking tour through the old town.

id_9.title: Seville Has a Special Color
id_9.desc_long: Monumental historic center, patios, and tiles. The Alcázar, the Cathedral, and the Santa Cruz neighborhood add to a powerful tapas culture and flamenco.

id_10.title: Medieval Tallinn
id_10.desc_long: Walled medieval old town, towers, and colorful roofs with views of the Baltic. Cold winter, but photogenic from Toompea.

id_11.title: Romantic Paris
id_11.desc_short: The city of light and love
id_11.desc_long: Urban romance: Seine, boulevards, and iconic museums. Neighborhoods with their own identity and street-side cafés; Notre Dame, Sacré-Cœur, and the Eiffel Tower as essential landmarks.

step_1.title: Eiffel Tower
step_1.desc: Picnic on the Champ de Mars.

id_12.title: Thermal Budapest
id_12.desc_long: Art Nouveau architecture, thermal baths, and night walks on the Danube. The Parliament shines at dusk from the Chain Bridge.

id_13.title: Renaissance in Florence
id_13.desc_long: Cradle of the Renaissance: Duomo, Uffizi, and crafts in the Oltrarno. A living museum-city where every street holds sculptures, palaces, and workshops.

id_14.title: Eternal Rome
id_14.desc_long: The “Eternal City” combines classic ruins, baroque squares, and neighborhood life. From the Pantheon to the Trevi Fountain, history coexists with trattorias and terraces.

id_15.title: Canals of Venice
id_15.desc_long: Without cars and with a unique aquatic layout. Canals, palaces, and bridges connect islands; from San Marcos to the quieter neighborhoods, it is pure contemplation.

step_2.title: Murano and Burano
step_2.desc: Visit to the glass and color islands.

id_16.title: Historic Valletta
id_16.desc_long: Fortified and baroque, with viewpoints to the Grand Harbour. Palaces, churches, and museums concentrated in a compact and walkable center.

id_17.title: Fjords from Bergen
id_17.desc_long: Wooden houses in Bryggen, lively port, and mountains falling into fjords. Perfect starting point for scenic routes.

id_18.title: Amsterdam by Bike
id_18.desc_long: UNESCO Heritage canals, narrow gables, and cycling culture. World-class museums and green neighborhoods connected by bridges.

id_19.title: Port Wines
id_19.desc_long: Tiles, bridges over the Douro, and Port wine cellars. Lello Bookstore and Leça swimming pools as contemporary icons.

step_1.title: Wine Tasting
step_1.desc: Visit to Vila Nova de Gaia cellars.

id_20.title: Cosmopolitan London
id_20.desc_long: History and avant-garde on the banks of the Thames. Free museums, immense parks, and an inexhaustible cultural and gastronomic scene.

id_21.title: Mystery of Edinburgh
id_21.desc_long: Royal Mile, castle, and green hills. Arthur’s Seat volcanic rock gives an exceptional panoramic view over the stone city.

id_22.title: Golden Prague
id_22.desc_long: Gothic domes and towers over a photogenic old town. Charles Bridge at dawn and historic cafés with music and literature.

id_23.title: Alps in Lucerne
id_23.desc_long: Lake, nearby mountains, and the Kapellbrücke as a postcard. Medieval roofs and alpine air just minutes from mountain routes.

id_24.title: Elegant Zurich
id_24.desc_long: Elegant old town by the lake, museums, galleries, and life by the water. Vibrant summers and Swiss efficiency in every detail.

id_25.title: Imperial Beijing
id_25.desc_long: Imperial capital with the Forbidden City, hutongs, and wide avenues. Gateway to nearby sections of the Great Wall and delicious regional cuisine.

id_26.title: Vertical Hong Kong
id_26.desc_long: Dense skyline around a port full of ferries. Mountains, islands, and nature reserves minutes from the financial center.

id_27.title: Vibrant Seoul
id_27.desc_long: Skyscrapers and palaces, night markets, and an impeccable metro network. Districts like Bukchon and Myeongdong show tradition and fashion.

id_28.title: Pink Jaipur
id_28.desc_long: The “Pink City”: Hawa Mahal, forts, and salmon-colored bazaars. Crafts, jewelry, and Rajasthan gastronomy in palaces and streets.

id_29.title: Zen Kyoto
id_29.desc_long: Temples, shrines, and classic gardens. Hanami in spring, tree-lined routes, and the possibility of crossing paths with geishas in Gion.

id_30.title: Spiritual Luang Prabang
id_30.desc_long: UNESCO Heritage next to the confluence of rivers. Monks processions at dawn, nearby waterfalls, and colonial-Buddhist architecture.

id_31.title: Historic Beirut
id_31.desc_short: The Paris of the Middle East
id_31.desc_long: Beaches, clubs, and rooftops facing mosques and historic souks. Gastronomy and nightlife with Mediterranean and Levantine flair.

id_32.title: Mystical Muscat
id_32.desc_long: Bays and mountains framing mosques, souks, and Portuguese forts. Coastal walks and white architecture next to the Gulf of Oman.

id_33.title: Future in Doha
id_33.desc_long: Corniche with futuristic skyline, Souq Waqif, and I. M. Pei's Museum of Islamic Art. Mix of tradition and new cultural areas.

id_34.title: Thai Chiang Mai
id_34.desc_long: Temples on the hillside, cafés, and creative markets. Starting point for northern nature and intense culinary experiences.

id_35.title: Chaos and Calm in Hanoi
id_35.desc_long: Lakes, temples, and French quarter with romantic flair. Narrow streets with traditional cafés and vibrant markets.

id_36.title: Future Singapore
id_36.desc_long: Garden-city with urban jungle, Botanical Garden, and Gardens by the Bay. Temples, heritage houses, and impeccable logistics to move around.

id_37.title: Blue Chefchaouen
id_37.desc_long: Blue medina between Rif mountains. Painted alleys, artisan doors, and nearby viewpoints to see the whole from above.

id_38.title: Cape Town and Penguins
id_38.desc_long: Table Mountain, beaches with penguins, and colorful neighborhoods like Bo-Kaap. Gardens, nearby vineyards, and scenic coastal routes.

id_39.title: Iconic Sydney
id_39.desc_long: Iconic Opera House, navigable bay, and urban beaches like Bondi. Everyday ferries and waterfront parks.

id_40.title: Adrenaline in Queenstown
id_40.desc_long: Adrenaline capital between lake and mountains. Natural viewpoints, adventures, and cinematic landscapes.

id_41.title: European Quebec
id_41.desc_long: Walled high town with views of the St. Lawrence. European atmosphere, steep roofs, and pink sunsets.

id_42.title: Rhythm of Havana
id_42.desc_long: Pastel-colored colonial architecture, music on every corner, and seaside promenades. Old Havana and the Malecon set the rhythm.

id_43.title: New York, New York
id_43.desc_long: Iconic architecture, parks like Central Park, and an incomparable artistic scene. Urban energy that never goes out.

id_44.title: Golden San Francisco
id_44.desc_long: Golden Gate Bridge, hills, and Victorian houses. World-class museums and neighborhoods with their own character.

id_45.title: Colonial San Miguel
id_45.desc_long: Colonial center with pink neo-Gothic parish church. Cobbled streets, patios, and art in galleries and workshops.

id_46.title: Porteño Buenos Aires
id_46.desc_long: Neighborhoods with identity (Recoleta, San Telmo, La Boca), varied architecture, and intense cultural life. Tango, steakhouses, and bookstores in emblematic buildings.

id_47.title: Samba Rio de Janeiro
id_47.desc_long: Mythical beaches, urban jungle, and Christ the Redeemer watching over bays and hills. Samba rhythm in streets and squares.

id_48.title: Colonial Cartagena
id_48.desc_long: Walls, squares, and colonial mansions covered in bougainvillea. Getsemaní and Bocagrande show their creative and modern faces.

id_49.title: Andean Quito
id_49.desc_long: Golden historic center under Andean volcanoes. Views from the Basilica of the National Vow and traditional markets.

id_50.title: Imperial Cusco
id_50.desc_long: Ancient Inca capital with squares, convents, and cobbled streets. Starting point to Machu Picchu and viewpoints like the White Christ.

id_51.title: Cultural Melbourne
id_51.desc_long: Considered the cultural capital of Australia. Get lost in its famous 'laneways' full of artistic graffiti, enjoy the best coffee in the world, and tour Victorian architecture mixed with modern skyscrapers.

step_1.title: Laneways
step_1.desc: Urban art tour in Hosier Lane.

id_52.title: Great Barrier Reef Diving
id_52.desc_long: Dive into the largest reef system in the world. Turtles, clownfish, and infinite colored corals await you in this unforgettable aquatic adventure.

step_2.title: Outer Reef
step_2.desc: Full day of diving or snorkeling.

step_3.title: Daintree Rainforest
step_3.desc: Visit to the oldest tropical forest.

id_53.title: Relax in Fiji
id_53.desc_long: Disconnect from the world in the heart of the South Pacific. Fiji welcomes you with its famous 'Bula' hospitality, immaculate white sand beaches, and crystal clear waters perfect for doing nothing.

id_54.title: Hobbiton and Maori Culture
id_54.desc_long: Enter the Shire visiting the Lord of the Rings movie set and discover the force of the earth in Rotorua with its geysers and rich Maori culture.

id_56.title: Great Migration Safari
id_56.desc_short: Wild nature in its purest state
id_56.desc_long: Witness the greatest natural spectacle on the planet. Traverse the endless plains of the Serengeti in search of the 'Big Five' and watch thousands of wildebeest and zebras cross the Mara River.

step_2.title: Game Drive
step_2.desc: Full day of lion and elephant sighting.

id_57.title: Pharaohs and Nile
id_57.desc_long: A journey back in time to ancient Egypt. From the imposing Pyramids of Giza to the temples of Luxor and Karnak, sailing on the river that gave life to a civilization.

step_1.title: Giza
step_1.desc: The Great Pyramids and the Sphinx.

step_3.title: Valley of the Kings
step_3.desc: Entrance to royal tombs in Luxor.

id_58.title: Victoria Falls
id_58.desc_long: Feel the power of one of the natural wonders of the world. Victoria Falls offer spectacular views, constant rainbows, and adrenaline-filled activities.

step_2.title: Devil's Pool
step_2.desc: Swim at the edge of the abyss (in season).

id_60.title: Namib Desert
id_60.desc_long: Landscapes that seem from another planet. Climb the Big Daddy dune, walk among the petrified acacias of Deadvlei, and contemplate one of the cleanest starry skies in the world.

id_61.title: Wild Patagonia
id_61.desc_short: Trekking at the end of the world
id_61.desc_long: Face the southern winds and walk among glaciers, turquoise lakes, and imposing granite towers. The W Circuit is a mecca for hikers from all over the world.

step_2.title: Base Torres
step_2.desc: The most iconic hike to the lagoon.

step_3.title: Grey Glacier
step_3.desc: Navigation in front of blue ice walls.

id_62.title: Pura Vida Costa Rica
id_62.desc_long: Immerse yourself in the country with the greatest biodiversity per square meter. Walk on hanging bridges through the mist, bathe in volcanic thermal waters, and look for quetzals and sloths.

step_2.title: Arenal Volcano
step_2.desc: Hike through dried lava and thermal baths.

reviews_mock.user1_text: "Simply spectacular. The organization was impeccable and the places we visited exceeded my expectations. Totally recommended."
reviews_mock.user2_text: "An unforgettable experience. The guide was very professional and the group was very fun. I will travel with Pack&Go again."

login_modal.msg_fav: You must have an account to save favorites.
login_modal.msg_buy: Please log in to complete your booking.

privacy.s1_text: This Privacy Policy governs the processing of personal data collected through the Pack&Go travel booking website (hereinafter, the "Website"). Access and use of the Website implies full and unreserved acceptance of the provisions of this policy. Pack&Go is committed to ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and security of user data.
privacy.s2_text: The data controller regarding personal data is Pack&Go S.L., with registered office at Calle Viajera 123, Madrid, Spain. For any queries related to data processing, the user may contact via email at privacy@packandgo.com.
privacy.s3_text:
Pack&Go may collect the following categories of data:

  • Identification data: name, surname, ID/Passport, and date of birth.
  • Contact data: email address, phone number, and postal address.
  • Financial data: credit/debit card information necessary to process payments.
  • Technical data: IP address, device type, browser, and browsing habits.
privacy.s4_text:
Data will be processed for the following purposes:

  • Manage and process travel and experience bookings.
  • Send confirmations, tickets, and travel documentation.
  • Provide customer service and resolve issues.
  • Comply with legal, accounting, and tax obligations.
  • Send commercial communications if authorized by the user.
privacy.s5_text: The legal basis for data processing is the execution of the tourism service contract (bookings), the user's express consent (for cookies or newsletters), and the legitimate interest of Pack&Go to improve its services.
privacy.s6_text: Personal data will be kept for the time necessary to fulfill the purposes for which they were collected and, subsequently, for the periods legally established to address possible liabilities arising from the processing.
privacy.s7_text: Pack&Go may communicate your data to third-party providers necessary for the provision of the service (hotels, airlines, transport companies, local guides) and to secure payment gateways. Data will not be sold to third parties for commercial purposes without your consent.
privacy.s8_text: We adopt the necessary technical and organizational measures to ensure data security and prevent alteration, loss, unauthorized processing, or access, taking into account the state of technology and the nature of the stored data.
privacy.s9_text: The user may exercise their rights of access, rectification, deletion, opposition, limitation of processing, and portability by sending a request to our contact email, attaching a copy of their identity document.
privacy.s10_text: This website uses first-party and third-party cookies to improve the browsing experience and obtain usage statistics. You can configure your browser to reject cookies, although this may affect the website's functionality.
privacy.s11_text: Pack&Go reserves the right to modify this Privacy Policy to adapt it to legislative or jurisprudential changes. Modifications will be published in this section.
privacy.s12_text: The use of the Website and the contracting of the offered services implies that the user has read, understood, and accepted this Privacy Policy in its entirety.
